name: Ruvuv Extension for Elementor
author: Ruvuv

sections.description:
Ruvuv Extension for Elementor is an extremely creative WordPress add-on plugin for Elementor Page Builder. This add-on extends the Elementor’s style in a new way that is hard to explain. This is a creative extended visual functionality Add-on for Elementor Page Builder that works in Section, Column and Widget’s background.

Check the demo.

13 FREE EXTENSIONS AND COUNTING

We have designed 13 of the most creative extensions to enhance your Elementor Page Building experience and allow you to climb the top of your design capabilities.

  • Background Image Moving
  • Multi-Color Motion
  • Background Media Slider
  • Responsive Column Order
  • Section/Column Link
  • Widget’s Max Width
  • Heading Expand
  • Rellax Parallax
  • Background Particle
  • Sticky
  • Tooltip
  • Schedule Content
  • Custom CSS
  • And counting…

Elementor page builder is required for this plugin.

Documentation and Support

  • For documentation and tutorials go to our Tutorial Section.
  • If you have any more questions, visit our support on the Plugin’s Forum.
  • For any other inquiry, support, feature request, or issues, check out our website at Support Page.
sections.installation:
Minimum Requirements

  • WordPress 4.7 or greater
  • PHP version 7 or greater
  • MySQL version 5.0 or greater

We recommend your host supports:

  • PHP version 7.0 or greater
  • MySQL version 5.6 or greater
  • WordPress Memory limit of 64 MB or greater (128 MB or higher is preferred)

Installation

  1. Install using the WordPress built-in Plugin installer, or Extract the zip file and drop the contents in the wp-content/plugins/ directory of your WordPress installation.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
sections.faq:
Can I use the plugin without Elementor Page Builder?

No. You cannot use without Elementor Page Builder since it’s an addon for Elementor.

Does it work with any theme?

Absolutely! It will work with any theme where Elementor works.

Does it work with Elementor Pro?

Yes, undoubtedly.
